description: Numbers n such that 10*3^n - 1 is prime.
comments: a(56) > 2*10^5. - _Robert Price_, Mar 16 2014All terms are verified primes (ie, not probable primes) - _Robert Price_, Mar 16 2014
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
H. C. Williams and C. R. Zarnke, Some prime numbers of the forms 2*3^n+1 and 2*3^n-1, Math. Comp., 26 (1972), 995-998.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 05 2001
